qas.question: Corruption aids what as far as the environment is concerned?
Formal legislation cannot be regulated when officials are what?
Bribes also halt unions, the protection of children in labor, and what?
When these laws are broken, corrupt countries gain what in the international market?

context: Corruption facilitates <a0_0>environmental destruction<a0_0/>. While corrupt societies may have formal legislation to protect the environment, it cannot be enforced if officials can easily be <a1_0>bribed<a1_0/>. The same applies to <a2_0>social rights worker protection<a2_0/>, unionization prevention, and child labor. Violation of these laws rights enables corrupt countries to gain <a3_0>illegitimate economic advantage<a3_0/> in the international market.
